text: Psalm 46
God Provides for and Protects His People
For the \add music\add* director. Of the sons of Korah.
According to Alamoth. A song.\f + \fr Ps 46 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
God \add is\add* our refuge and strength,
a very sufficient help in troubles.
Therefore we will not fear though \add the\add* earth change,
and though the mountains totter into \add the\add* ⸤midst⸥\f + \fr 46:2 \ft Literally “heart” \f* of \add the\add* sea,
though its waters roar \add and\add* foam,
though mountains shake with its surging \add water\add*. \qs Selah\qs*
\add There is\add* a river whose streams gladden the city of God,
the holiest of the dwellings of the Most High.
God \add is\add* in the midst of her;
she will not be made to totter.
God will help her ⸤at daybreak⸥.\f + \fr 46:5 \ft Literally “at the turning of the morning” \f*
Nations roar, kingdoms shake;
he utters his voice, \add the\add* earth melts.
Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* with us;
our \add high\add* stronghold \add is\add* the God of Jacob. \qs Selah\qs*
Come, see the works of Yahweh,
who has placed desolations on the earth.
\add He\add* makes wars cease to the ends of the earth;
he breaks \add the\add* bow and cuts off \add the\add* spear.
\add The\add* wagons \add of war\add* he burns with fire.
Be still, and know that I \add am\add* God.
I will be exalted among the nations;
I will be exalted in the earth.
Yahweh of Hosts \add is\add* with us;
the God of Jacob \add is\add* our \add high\add* stronghold.
